sequence: 2. Transfer to OR for laparoscopic bowel assessment
3. Convert to laparotomy only if resection needed
advantages: Avoids unnecessary laparotomy in some cases
disadvantages: Laparoscopy may be limited in distended abdomen

endovascular_then_laparotomy.indication: When bowel resection is expected or peritonitis present

sequence: 4. Immediate bowel assessment and resection if needed

technique: 4. Angioplasty and stenting from SMA toward aorta
retrograde_open_mesenteric_stenting.indication: Failed antegrade access, proximal SMA disease, at laparotomy
advantages: Combines open exposure with endovascular technique

ideal_for_hybrid: Need for rapid revascularization AND bowel assessment
Endovascular-amenable lesion but concern for necrosis

advantages_demonstrated: May reduce mortality compared to delayed surgery

OR_setup.portable_imaging: C-arm can be used in standard OR
OR_setup.coordination: Requires OR, anesthesia, vascular surgery, potentially IR

timing.waiting: Allow 15-30 minutes for reperfusion before viability assessment

related.relationship: Hybrid approach addresses the open vs endovascular dilemma
